IRS990.Desc: ESSENTIALS - THROUGH ESSENTIALS FOR FOSTER KIDS PROGRAM, THE FOUNDATION HOLDS COLLECTION DRIVES, WORKS WITH RETAILERS TO RECEIVE PRODUCTS, FUNDS BULK PURCHASES OF ESSENTIALS AND PROVIDES FUNDING FOR NON-PROFIT PARTNERS TO PURCHASE ADDITIONAL ESSENTIAL ITEMS INCLUDING: CLOTHING, SHOES, HYGIENE ITEMS, SCHOOL SUPPLIES, TOYS, BOOKS AND BASIC CHILDHOOD NEEDS. THESE ITEMS QUICKLY PROVIDE FOSTER YOUTH WITH EVERYDAY NEEDS WHILE BOOSTING SELF WORTH AND HELPING THEM FIT IN WITH PEERS. RECIPIENT ORGANIZATIONS HAVE COMPLETED AN APPLICATION, PARTNER AGREEMENT AND ACKNOWLEDGE EACH DONATION.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: TAKE FLIGHT - THROUGH THE TAKE FLIGHT PROGRAM THE FOUNDATION'S GOAL IS TO EMPOWER FOSTER YOUTH FOR THE FUTURE, PARTICULARLY PREPARING YOUTH PRIOR TO AND WHILE AGING OUT OF CARE. PROGRAM FUNDS HOUSING, LIFE SKILLS, EMERGENCY SUPPORT, EDUCATION SUPPORT AND BULK PURCHASES LAPTOPS FOR FOSTER STUDENTS TO INCREASE THEIR ODDS OF GRADUATION AND DECREASE ODDS OF HOMELESSNESS UPON AGING OUT.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: ALLY PROGRAM - TICKET TO DREAM FOUNDATION IS AN ALLY TO THOSE IN FOSTER CARE WHO ARE OFTEN UNDERREPRESENTED AND UNDERSERVED. OUR ALLY PROGRAM PROVIDES TARGETED SUPPORT TO MEED THE UNIQUE NEEDS OF HISPANIC, BLACK, AND LGBTQ+ FOSTER YOUTH.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: SCHOLARSHIPS-THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES EACH OF THEIR BOARD MEMBERS THE OPPORTUNITY TO DESIGNATE A SCHOLARSHIP/GRANT TO IMPROVE THE LIVES OF FOSTER YOUTH.
GO PLAY! - THE FOUNDATION'S GOPLAY! PROGRAM BRINGS JOY AND NORMAL CHILDHOOD EXPERIENCES TO FOSTER YOUTH ACROSS THE NATION BY PROVIDING ACCESS TO EXTRA-CURRICULAR ACTIVITIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FUNDRAISING DIRECT EXPENSES RECLASSED FROM EXPENSE 82,606. NON-CASH PRIZE CONTRIBUTIONS TO FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 63,000.
FUNDRAISING DIRECT EXPENSES RECLASSED TO REVENUE 82,606. NON-CASH PRIZE CONTRIBUTIONS TO FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 63,000.
GROSS GAMING REVENUE CONSISTS SOLEY OF PROCEEDS RECEIVED FROM THE SALE OF RAFFLE TICKETS AT THE FOUNDATION'S ANNUAL RAISING GOLF TOURNAMENT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: TICKET TO DREAM FOUNDATION DONATES ONLY TO OTHER SECTION 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATIONS THAT ARE REQUIRED TO MONITOR THEIR USE OF GRANT FUNDS.

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.RelationshipDescriptionTxt: DALE IS A 60% OWNER MEMBER OF BUNKER WILSON,LLC MANAGEMENT COMPANY
BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.TransactionDesc: INDEPENDENT CONTRACTOR ARRANGEMENT FOR MANAGEMENT SERVICES

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART I, LINE 1, DESCRIPTION OF ORGANIZATION MISSION
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: TICKET TO DREAM FOUNDATION PROVIDES IN-KIND AND MONETARY CONTRIBUTIONS TO NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS LOCATED THROUGHOUT THE UNITED STATES WITH PARTICULAR EMPHASIS ON CHARITIES RELATED TO CHILDREN IN NEED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART III, LINE 1, DESCRIPTION OF ORGANIZATION MISSION
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: TICKET TO DREAM FOUNDATION PROVIDES IN-KIND AND MONETARY CONTRIBUTIONS TO NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS LOCATED THROUGHOUT THE UNITED STATES. OUR CHARITABLE PURPOSE IS TO SUPPORT WORTHY CHARITABLE CAUSES AND CHARITIES WITH PARTICULAR EMPHASIS ON CHARITIES RELATED TO CHILDREN IN NEED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: LINE 2 EXPLANATION - BUSINESS RELATIONSHIPS: THE FOUNDATION DOES REIMBURSE BUNKER WILSON FOR ADMINISTRATIVE SUPPORT. EXPENSE IS RECORDED AS MANAGEMENT FEES. HOWEVER, BUNKER WILSON, LLC DOES NOT HAVE CONTROL OVER THE FOUNDATION BECAUSE TEN OUT OF THE TWELVE VOTING BOARD OF DIRECTORS ARE UNRELATED TO EITHER A BUSINESS OR FAMILY RELATIONSHIP. JANET ANTON AND REBEKAH HEISKELL, OFFICERS OF THE ORGANIZATION, ARE EMPLOYEES OF BUNKER WILSON, LLC THAT PROVIDES SERVICES TO THE FOUNDATION. FAMILY RELATIONSHIP: DALE CARLSEN (OFFICER) AND KATHRYN CARLSEN (BOARD MEMBER) ARE MARRIED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: LINE 11A EXPLANATION - THE INITIAL REVIEW OF THE FORM 990 IS PERFORMED BY OFFICERS OF THE ORGANIZATION WITH SUBSEQUENT BOARD MEETING DISCUSSIONS. A COPY IS PROVIDED TO ALL FINANCE COMMITTEE MEMBERS BEFORE FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS REVIEWS ALL OFFICERS AND DIRECTORS ANNUALLY TO DETERMINE THAT THERE ARE NO CONFLICTS OF INTEREST IN ADDITION TO REQUIRING DISCLOSURE OF POTENTIAL CONFLICTS BY SUCH PERSONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: WHEN HIRING KEY PERSONNEL, THE PRESIDENT PREPARES A COMPARABILITY ANALYSIS TO ENSURE COMPENSATION IS APPROPRIATE. SALARY AND BENEFIT REPORTS PRODUCED BY INDEPENDENT ORGANIZATIONS INVOLVED IN PHILANTHROPIC COMPANY MANAGEMENT ARE REVIEWED BY MANAGEMENT. PROPOSED COMPENSATION IS COMPARED TO INDUSTRY AVERAGES FOR THE SAME JOB DESCRIPTION AND GEOGRAPHICAL AREA AND REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE CEO, CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD OR FINANCE COMMITTEE. ONCE APPROVED BY THE BOARD, THE PROPOSED COMPENSATION BECOMES FINAL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DOCUMENTS ARE AVAIABLE UPON REQUEST. AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE ON ORGANIZATION'S WEBSITE.
